dependencies.description:
PBR is a library that injects some useful and sensible default behaviors
into your setuptools run.
dependencies.name: py-pbr

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
CacheControl is a port of the caching algorithms in httplib2 for use
with requests session object.
dependent_to.name: py-cachecontrol

dependent_to.description:
Library to implement a well-behaved Unix daemon process. This library
implements the well-behaved daemon specification of PEP Standard daemon
process. A well-behaved Unix daemon process is tricky to get right, but
the required steps are much the same for every daemon program. A
DaemonContext instance holds the behaviour and configured process
environment for the program; use the instance as a context manager to
enter a daemon state.
dependent_to.name: py-python-daemon

dependent_to.description: Box of handy tools for Sphinx.
dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-toolbox

description:
The lockfile package exports a LockFile class which provides a simple
API for locking files. Unlike the Windows msvcrt.locking function, the
fcntl.lockf and flock functions, and the deprecated posixfile module,
the API is identical across both Unix (including Linux and Mac) and
Windows platforms. The lock mechanism relies on the atomic nature of the
link (on Unix) and mkdir (on Windows) system calls. An implementation
based on SQLite is also provided, more as a demonstration of the
possibilities it provides than as production-quality code.
name: py-lockfile

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
